setting.conf_title_desc: This section allows you to maintain your board guidelines. If enabled, a link will be added to the board header linking to the board guidelines.

setting.conf_title: Show link in header to guidelines?
External http:// link to guidelines page?
setting.conf_description: Enter the URL to a set of external guidelines or if you wish to add your guidelines below simply leave this box clear.

setting.conf_title: If not using external link; guidelines/rules text
setting.conf_description: HTML Enabled
The content of this section will be displayed before a member can register a new account. HTML ENABLED
setting.conf_default: Forum Terms & Rules Please take a moment to review these rules detailed below. If you agree with them and wish to proceed with the registration, simply click the "Register" button below. To cancel this registration, simply hit the 'back' button on your browser. Please remember that we are not responsible for any messages posted. We do not vouch for or warrant the accuracy, completeness or usefulness of any message, and are not responsible for the contents of any message. The messages express the views of the author of the message, not necessarily the views of this bulletin board. Any user who feels that a posted message is objectionable is encouraged to contact us immediately by email. We have the ability to remove objectionable messages and we will make every effort to do so, within a reasonable time frame, if we determine that removal is necessary. You agree, through your use of this service, that you will not use this bulletin board to post any material which is knowingly false and/or defamatory, inaccurate, abusive, vulgar, hateful, harassing, obscene, profane, sexually oriented, threatening, invasive of a person's privacy, or otherwise violative of any law. You agree not to post any copyrighted material unless the copyright is owned by you or by this bulletin board.

setting.conf_title_desc: Use this setting to turn switch your board online or offline and leave a message for your visitors.

setting.conf_description: The board will still be accessable by those who have permission (settable from the Users & Groups section).

setting.conf_title_desc: This section will allow you to set up the board calendar and its related options.

setting.conf_title: Show birthdays on the main calendar view?
setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", the calendar will show the number of birthdays for that day.

setting.conf_title: Show Today's birthdays on the board view?
setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", this will show the day's birthdays on the board index view.

setting.conf_title: Auto hide when no birthdays to show?
setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", this will remove the "Today's Birthdays" block from the board index when there is none to show.
If set to "yes", this will show single forthcoming calendar events on the board index view. It will not show recurring events or ranged events.

setting.conf_title: Auto hide when no events to show?
setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", this will remove the forcoming calendar events block from the board index view if there are none to show.

setting.conf_title: Show forthcoming events from today to [x] days ahead
setting.conf_description: Controls how far into the future events are shown on the forcoming events block on board index view.

setting.conf_title: Starting year for calendar 'Year' drop down box
setting.conf_description: This applies to view calendar / post event.

setting.conf_title: Year end limit for 'Year' drop down box
setting.conf_description:
This applies to view calendar / post event.
Example: current year is 2002, you enter 5 - last choosable year = 2007
The default behavior for the calendar is to start the week on Sunday. By setting this to yes, you will start the week on Monday instead.

setting.conf_title_desc: This section allows you to set the default cookie options.

setting.conf_description: Hint: use .your-domain.com for global cookie
Allows multiple boards on one host.
Relative path from domain to root IBF dir

setting.conf_title: Create a stronghold auto-log in cookie?
setting.conf_description: If enabled, when a member logs in, an additional cookie is set which contains geographic information in a crypt to make cookie stealing almost impossible. Only turn off if users cannot stay logged in

setting.conf_title_desc: This section allows you to comply with COPPA.

setting.conf_description: Enabling COPPA on your board will require children under the age of 13 to get parental consent via a faxed or mailed form.

setting.conf_title: Fax number to receive COPPA forms
Mail address to receive COPPA forms

setting.conf_description: This text will be displayed on the parental consent form and can be used to include your privacy policy (a requirement for COPPA compliance)

setting.conf_title_desc: This section allows certain features to be limited or removed to get more performance out of your board.

setting.conf_title: Allow custom profile field info be used in TopicView?
setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", this will add a LEFT JOIN onto the custom profile field table.
Not recommended if your board isn't visited daily.

setting.conf_title: Cut off for active user display [in minutes]
Storing Read Topics in the Database
setting.conf_description: Enter how many days you wish to store read topic information for. For large busy boards we recommend keeping it to around 7 days to prevent a large slow database table. The task manager will prune back this table to keep it manageable. Enter 0 (zero) to NOT store read topic info in the database.

If enabled, the topic views counter will be updated as one loads a topic. If not enabled, the topic views will be written to another table and the topic views updated every 3 hours. This will significantly reduce overhead on the topics table if you have a very busy board as it overcomes the write lock initiated when the topic counter is updated.

setting.conf_title: Mark topics a user has posted when displaying a forum?

setting.conf_description: This save 1 query per forum view
(This save 1 query per topic view)
Do you wish to disable the topic summary from displaying at the bottom of the post reply page?

setting.conf_title: Allow users (where allowed) to use search?

setting.conf_description: Show the board totals at the footer of the board index page.

Will display 'busy' message when limit hit
Can be left blank for no limit

(This will stop browsers caching pages)
Note: The setting 'Print HTTP Headers?' found under General Configuration needs to be enabled for this setting to have any effect.

Refers to when returning search results as posts
Leave blank to return full post with proper formatting
Do you wish to disable subforums from displaying on the board index?
This will remove sub-forums from the drop down list - useful if you have many
Enable multi-byte safe wordwrap function? Uses a lot more resources for wordwrap functionality, but necessary for languages with multi-byte characters.

setting.conf_title_desc: This section contains the date and time formats used throughout the board.

setting.conf_description: If you have chosen the correct timezone and the clock is an hour out, this is because of daylight savings time and your members can correct this by editing their 'Board settings' via their User Control Panel.

You fine tune the server time. If you need to subtract minutes from the server time, start the number with a '-' (no quotes)
Board time (inc. above time zone and current adj.) is now: <-T->
Same configuration as PHP Date
Same configuration as <a href='http://www.php.net/date' target='_blank'>PHP Date
Same configuration as PHP Date
Would use 'today' and 'yesterday' in posts / last post info
setting.conf_extra: 0=No 1=Yes ( Today & Yesterday ) 2=Yes ( Last X Minutes, Today & Yesterday) 3=Yes ( Full, minutes, hours & days )

setting.conf_description: {--} Will be replaced with 'today' or 'yesterday'
When daylight saving time auto-detection is enabled, your member's profiles will be automatically updated with the correct time.

setting.conf_title_desc: Settings to control display names on the forums.

setting.conf_description: If enabled, the member can choose a "Display Name" that is separate from their "Log in UserName". This is REQUIRED when using non-internal authentication methods.

setting.conf_title: Prohibit Display Names from selecting Log In names
setting.conf_description: If "yes", one is not able to choose a display name that is the same as another's display name OR another's log in name. If "no" one is not able to choose a display name that is the same as another's display name only.
The maxiumum number of characters that a display name can be.

If this is set, Invision Board will ensure all usernames only contain characters in this list upon registration.

To allow only alphanumeric usernames, use: a-zA-Z0-9

If you specify the characters allowed in usernames, and a user tries to register with a name that has invalid characters, what error message should be displayed?
Tip:You can use {chars} to show the characters allowed
setting.conf_default: The name can only contain these characters: {chars}

setting.conf_title_desc: This section will allow you to change the incoming and outgoing email addresses as well as the email method.

setting.conf_description: This is the email address that all incoming mail is addressed to.
This is the email address that all mail appears to come from.
If PHP's mail() isn't available, choose SMTP. If you are unsure, please ask your web host.
Default is 'localhost'
Default is 25
Some SMTP mailers require that email addresses are in the following format '<' address '>' (no quotes). If you are getting errors in the mail error log, enabled this option
Not required in most cases when using 'localhost'
Not required in most cases when using 'localhost'
Example: -femail@address.com will force a 'From' header.

setting.conf_title_desc: These settings control the basics of the board such as URLs and paths.

setting.conf_description: This is the name of the board. It is used as the first link in the navigation menu, etc.
This is the name of your website. If this and "Website Address' is filled in, your website address and name will appear on the board above the header by default.
This is the URL to your website. If entered, it'll appear on the board above the header by default.
The URL to your "uploads" folder. <!--SUGGEST-->
This is a path, not a URL. <!--SUGGEST-->

This can be left blank
This is useful for specifing a PATH for the IPB written files (skin_cache, style_avatars, style_emoticons, style_images) when dealing with load balanced/clustered servers. If you enter a PATH, please ensure that it ends with a trailing slash
Enter the document character set for all HTML pages.

This can be left blank
This can be used if you wish to serve images from a different server or when using clustered servers. Please ensure that you use a trailing slash and that it starts with http(s):// if entering a URL
Some NT installations will require this to be turned to 'no'.
This is for quick no-page redirects. Choose the option best suited to your server's OS.
setting.conf_extra: location=Location type (*nix savvy) refresh=Refresh (Windows savvy) html=HTML META redirect (If all else fails...)

setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", this will remove any "Thanks...." redirection pages used to provide feedback to the user on their last action and will simply redirect without showing this page.
This controls the debug information shown at the footer of your board.
setting.conf_extra: 0=0: None - Don't show any debug information 1=1: Show server load, page generation times and query count 2=2: Show level 1 (above) and GET and POST information 3=3: Show level 1 + 2 and database queries

setting.conf_description: GZIP enables faster page transfers and lower bandwidth use however some servers are not configured to allow it.
This setting is automatically set during installation but you can override the setting here if you wish. Safe mode skins doesn't cache to PHP files and uses the database exclusively.

You may choose which character to separate thousands from hundreds
(EG: USA & UK use a comma)
Character used to seperate decimals in numbers.
GD is an embedded graphics library in PHP. Most recent PHP installations come with GD2 which offers improved image functions. If you get errors by setting this to "GD2", then simply choose "GD1".
Would you like to enable the help system in the ACP to provide some additional helpful information?

setting.conf_title_desc: This will allow you to customize your Invision Chat integration settings for the new 2004 edition

setting.conf_description: If you are using Parachat v7 or greater, enter your site ID (1234, for example). If you are using an older version of Parachat please enter your group number (ip0000, for example)
This should be left blank unless you have a local ParaChat Server installation or hosted ParaChat Enterprise solution.
The version of the Parachat chat software you're using
setting.conf_extra: 6=Parachat v6 or below 7=Parachat v7 or greater

setting.conf_description: If enabled, this will show who's chatting in the chat room on your forums home page underneath the active users list.

setting.conf_title: Hide Who's Chatting when no members are logged into chat?
Chat Room Pop-up Window Padding? (in px)
setting.conf_description: Allows window to open without scrollbars

setting.conf_title: Allow chat access to these groups
setting.conf_description: You may select more than one
This is the default language used for the chat user inteface (buttons and labels, etc)
setting.conf_extra: english.conf=English spanish.conf=Spanish portuguese.conf=Portuguese italian.conf=Italian french.conf=French german.conf=German

setting.conf_description: This is the type of chat service you purchased
This is the room that your chat users will be logged into first

"Plain mode" removes the colored chat text from your Invision Power Chat Advanced room(s), and implements single-colored (non-GUI) chat text. This will disable the graphic emoticons and click-able URLs.
To change your chat applet background color select any RGB value.
To change your chat applet foreground color select any RGB value.
To change your chat window background color select any RGB value.
To change your chat window foreground color select any RGB value.
To customize your font size replace "10" to whatever numeric value you wish.

setting.conf_title_desc: This will allow you to customize your Invision Chat integration settings for the legacy edition.

setting.conf_description: Removing this number will remove all links / chat functionality within IPB.
<!--SERVER-->
If enabled, this will show who's chatting in the chat room on your forums home page underneath the active users list.

setting.conf_title: Hide Who's Chatting when no members are logged into chat?
Update local list no less than every:
setting.conf_description: The local list is updated from the master chat server by the frequency you set and cached locally.

setting.conf_title: Changed your IPChat control panel password?
setting.conf_description: If you have changed your IPChat control panel password, please add the new password here. Leave blank if it's not changed.

setting.conf_title: ENTER YOUR IPCHAT CONTROL PANEL PASSWORD
setting.conf_description: You must enter your IPChat control panel password to allow retrieval of the Who's Chatting list.

setting.conf_title: Chat Room Pop-up Window Padding? (in px)
setting.conf_description: Allows window to open without scrollbars

setting.conf_extra: en=English ar=Arabic de=German es=Spanish fr=French hr=Croation it=Italian iw=Hebrew nl=Dutch pl=Polish pt=Portuguese

setting.conf_title: Allow chat access to these groups
setting.conf_description: You may select more than one

setting.conf_title: Allow ADMIN access to these groups
setting.conf_description: You may select more than one - please choose carefully!

setting.conf_title_desc: These settings define the workings of your IP.Converge installation.

setting.conf_description:
If 'yes', you can use your IP.Converge installation to 'Converge' this board.
WARNING
IP.Converge is a beta product and should be used in a controlled environment only. Enabling it on a production board could compromise the safety of your IPB installation.

setting.conf_title_desc: Hidden settings

setting.conf_description: If 'yes', this IPB will authenticate against IP.Converge.
The root URL of the converge application.
The product ID assigned from the IP.Converge server

setting.conf_title_desc: This section allows you to manage your copyright removal key.

setting.conf_description: Your copyright removal key obtained from IPS.

setting.conf_title_desc: This section will allow you to edit your IPB registered license settings.

setting.conf_description:
This is the IPB registraton key NOT your customer code or client center password. To get your key, log into your client center and click on 'Invision Power Board' under 'Your Purchases'.
DO NOT REMOVE OR EDIT THIS KEY UNLESS YOU'RE SURE OF WHAT YOU'RE DOING!
If enabled, you can optionally add a "Licensed to" line at the bottom of your board.
Examples: Matthew Mecham, IPS, Inc.

setting.conf_title_desc: Hidden settings, so there.
These settings enable you to enable or disable IPB Portal and control the options IPB Portal offers.

setting.conf_description: If 'yes', IPB Portal can be accessed via 'index.php?act=home'.
This will appear inbetween the title elements on the page
<a href='http://www.php.net/date'>Same as PHP's date function

One per line in this format
http://www.apple.com [Apple's Website]

{board_url} will convert into your board

setting.conf_title: Show Affiliates / Favoured Sites box content
setting.conf_description: Raw HTML enabled

setting.conf_title_desc: Controls to determine which (if any) logs you wish to regularly prune.

setting.conf_description: Do you wish to prune spider logs regularly (default every 30 days)?
Do you wish to prune task logs regularly (default every 30 days)?
Do you wish to prune admin logs regularly (default every 30 days)?
Do you wish to prune moderator logs regularly (default every 30 days)?
Do you wish to prune email logs regularly (default every 30 days)?
Do you wish to prune email error logs regularly (default every 30 days)?
Do you wish to prune SQL Error logs older than 30 days?

setting.conf_title_desc: This section will allow you to specify the forum you wish to export news topics from to be used with ssi.php and the IPB Portal.

setting.conf_title: Export news topics from which forum?
Show a 'Latest News' link on the board index?

setting.conf_title_desc: This section allows you to control the global PM options.

setting.conf_description: BBCode is the [tag][/tag] format used to format text and apply other effects.
If set to "yes", your members will be allowed to use HTML in their personal messages. We recommend that you disbale this for security reasons.

setting.conf_title: Max. number of messages to show per page when viewing message list
setting.conf_description: The default is 50.
Members will not be able to block private messages from members in the selected groups. You may select more than one.
Members in the selected groups will be able to send private messages to other members, even when their inbox is 'full'.

setting.conf_title: Enter URL to poll topic for inclusion
setting.conf_description: Leave blank to not show a poll or the poll box

setting.conf_title_desc: Settings for the "recent topics" plug in of the portal

setting.conf_description: You may select more than one.
This is the number of topics you wish to display for the "recent_topics_last_x" portal tag.
Enter the number of topic titles shown on the list for the "recent_discussions_last_x" tag

setting.conf_title_desc: This section will allow you to set up and maintain your search engine bot spider recognition settings.

setting.conf_title: Enable the search engine spider recognition?
setting.conf_description: If set to "no", this feature will not be activated and all the settings below will have no effect.
If you're under heavy attack, switch this off as it may put a little extra load on the SQL server as it attempts to insert new data rows.

setting.conf_title: Treat spider/bot as part of which group?
setting.conf_description: This is useful as you can specify group settings for a 'bot' group which can restrict access to certain areas, etc.
This is useful as you can create a 'lite' optimized skin for your spiders to use to reduce bandwidth and increase the depth of the bot crawling.

setting.conf_title: Show spider/bot in the active users list?

setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", this makes all spider bots anonymous and they can only be seen by administrators.

Use this section to list which search engine user-agents you'd like to be treated as a search engine visit along with a 'human' name for the online list in a bot=Human Name format.(one per line)
Example: googlebot=Google.com
setting.conf_default: googlebot=Google.com slurp@inktomi=Hot Bot ask jeeves=Ask Jeeves lycos=Lycos.com whatuseek=What You Seek ia_archiver=Archive.org

setting.conf_title_desc: This section contains settings for your IPB's search system

setting.conf_description: Choose between "full text" searching or "manual" searching.
This setting will only take effect if using full text searching
Allowing shorter search words can return more results, such as 'if', 'at', etc. Note, if using the fulltext search method, your MySQL configuration may override this setting.
Select the forums you don't wish to search for new posts when using either the 'get active topics' or 'view new posts' links. You may select more than one.
If you are using manual search and your SQL server supports fulltext searching, a note is shown on the admin home page. You can manually hide it by changing this to yes.

setting.conf_title_desc: These options allow you to adjust the security and privacy options for your board.

setting.conf_description: "Completely Automated Public Turing Test to Tell Computers and Humans Apart": forces users to input a random code when registering and changing email address, etc to prevent bot's from spamming the forums.
setting.conf_extra: 0=None gd=Advanced (Requires GD library) gif=Normal (No special requirements)

setting.conf_description: If 'yes', the captcha image will use a random font located in the '/style_captcha/captcha_fonts' directory.
Do you wish to require guests who post (where allowed) to input a code to confirm their post?
setting.conf_extra: 0=None gd=Advanced (Requires GD library) gif=Normal (No special requirements)

setting.conf_description: If 'yes' users can post scripted image generators that are PHP/CGI scripts designed to 'look' like an image. This is used for random signature images, etc but can allow users to write malicious scripts which can interfere with the board.

If enabled, this will check the X_FORWARDED_FOR headers to match the user's IP address. This is useful in a intranet situation if the REMOTE_ADDR will be the same across the network. It will also help maintain AOL sessions but can be abused to forge incorrect headers to report an incorrect IP address. If unsure, leave off.
Please choose which lost password method you wish to use. We recommend using 'Email Random Password' as it's the most secure method.
setting.conf_extra: random=Email Random Password choose=Allow User to Enter New Password

setting.conf_description: It is advised that a member's log in key (used in cookies for persistent log in) expires weekly if not used. This increases the security of your board by exposing log in data for a week limiting the time frame a hacker would have to use the key if stolen.
setting.conf_extra: 0=Do not expire (not recommended) 3=Expire after 3 days 7=Expire after 7 days 30=Expire after 30 days

setting.conf_title: Reset member's log in key upon each log in?
setting.conf_description: If 'yes', each successful log in process will reset the member's auth key which is used in cookies as a password. This will make it impossible to remain logged into more than one computer.
Removes inactive sessions over the limit you specify. The lower the number the less chance of a session being hijacked.

setting.conf_title: Match user's IP Address during session validation
setting.conf_description: If 'yes', the IP address of the user must match the one stored in the sessions table for security. Only use 'no' in an intranet environment where many users share the same IP address.

setting.conf_title: Match user's browser during session validation
setting.conf_description: This further reduces the risk of session hijacking and tampering but it does mean that a user will have their session terminated if they use another browser at the same time.

setting.conf_title: Lock user account after how many failed login attempts
setting.conf_description:
How many failed login attempts should a user be allowed before the account is locked?
Tip: Set to 0 to disable

setting.conf_title: Reset failed login attempts after how many minutes
setting.conf_description:
Reset the login attempts after how many minutes?
Tip: Set to 0 to not reset failed login attempts until a succesful login occurs

If an account is locked due to failed login attempts, do you wish for the account to unlock after the defined time period has passed since their failed login attempt?
Tip: Setting this to no will require you to manually unlock accounts under the Management tab

setting.conf_title: Use secure mail form for member to member mails?
setting.conf_description: Hides the email address from other users and prevents email harvesting bots from gathering your members email addresses.
Advanced programmers can force images to run as scripts. IBF limits damage by this method however. This should only be disabled as an extreme measure.

setting.conf_title: Allow flash movies in posts and avatars?
setting.conf_description: Flash has a built in scripting language which may or may not compromise security. As flash gets more advanced the chances of it compromising your board increases. We recommend you leave this feature set to "no" unless you trust your community.

setting.conf_title: Remove the ACP link from the board
setting.conf_description: If 'yes', the ACP link will not be displayed in the board header. This is useful if you rename the default 'admin' folder.

Make an administrator manually preview all new accounts or make new users validate their email address. If "User then Admin" validation is selected, the user receives a validation email. On successful user validation, the user is entered into the administration approval queue.
setting.conf_extra: admin_user=User then Admin Validation user=User Email Validation admin=Admin Validation 0=None

setting.conf_title: Remove incomplete registration validations after [x] days
setting.conf_description: This will automatically remove all unvalidated members after the number of days you specify. Enter "0" to not automatically remove unvalidated members.

setting.conf_title: Get notified when a new user registers via email?
setting.conf_description: This will send an email to the board incoming email address when a new user successfully registers on the board.

setting.conf_title: Force guests to log in before allowing access to the board?
setting.conf_description: If set to yes, any guest must either log in or register before they can view the board.
If set to "yes", this will not allow any guests to register an account on your board.
Can be used as a 'hidden' space to emulate registered names - but can cause problems in non Western character sets.

setting.conf_title: Disable 'Report this post to a moderator' link?
setting.conf_description: Removes the ability for your members to report a post.
Where do you want reported post notifications to go?

Make users wait before posting again
Can be left blank for no flood control and does not apply to members which belong to a group that can bypass flood control.

setting.conf_title: Allow users to browse the Active Users list?
setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", members and guests where allowed will be able to determine the whereabouts of each other on the online list. Topics and forums that the viewer doesn't have permission to see are not shown.
Do you wish to disable members' ability to login anonymously?

setting.conf_title: Disable root admin group viewing anonymous online users?
setting.conf_description: Anonymous users have an asterisk after their name

setting.conf_title: Display IPB version on your site?
setting.conf_description: Do you wish to display the version of Invision Power Board you are running in your copyright footer?

setting.conf_title: Disable root admin group viewing online users IP address in online user list?

setting.conf_title_desc: These settings control various subscription manager features.

setting.conf_description: If enabled, the subscription packages will be shown in the registration page and the registering member will be able to select one.

setting.conf_title: Force every member to require a subscriptions package
setting.conf_description: If enabled, the member must choose a package upon registration to proceed past the validating group and current members must purchase a subscription to view the board.

setting.conf_title: Member group to use after registration but before package purchase?
setting.conf_description: If you require that every member purchases a subscription, choose a group to move the member into once they have validated their registration prior to purchasing a subscriptions manager package. Members in this group will see the 'Purchase Subscriptions' page when logged in and if they don't already have a package.

setting.conf_title_desc: These options control various elements when posting, reading topics and reading polls.

setting.conf_title: Number of topics per forum page
Remove excess exclamation/question marks in topic titles?
setting.conf_description: Will turn: This!!!!! into This!

setting.conf_title: Number of rating votes required to show
setting.conf_description: The number of actual rating votes needed before the topic's rating value is displayed.
Will turn: CLICK HERE into Click Here

setting.conf_title: Number of posts needed to make a 'hot topic'?

setting.conf_description: Maximum topic title length allowed.

setting.conf_title: Number of posts per topic page

setting.conf_description: Please enter the percentage to reduce the image to
If yes, any images posted with the [IMG] tag will be resized to prevent large images from breaking the layout of your board.

setting.conf_title: Outline View: Number of posts per page
setting.conf_description: This controls how many posts are shown in the threaded tree per page. This helps to reduce server overhead on very large topics.
Selects the default topic view mode from 'Outline', 'Standard' and 'Linear Plus'.
Members of the groups selected will not be able to be ignored.

setting.conf_title: Order posts within a topic by
Order posts within a topic by
Max. height of posted Flash movies (in pixels)
setting.conf_description: When using the [flash] tags where allowed

setting.conf_title: Max. width of posted Flash movies (in pixels)
setting.conf_description: When using the [flash] tags where allowed

setting.conf_title: No. characters to word wrap on?
setting.conf_description: Prevents long unbroken words which distort tables. 80 - 100 is recommended
Use this to stop multiple quote embedding which can cause some browsers to hang or crash.
When a member posts twice within n minutes, once after the other in a topic they will be merged into one post. Enter the number of minutes to capture concurrent posts. Enter 0 to not use.

This will remove any quoted text when quoting a post that contains quotes
..

Defines which images are allowed in [img][/img] tags.
Seperate with comma (gif,jpeg,jpg)

If you would like to filter urls based on your blacklist or whitelist settings, enable this. URL filtering allows you to explicitely allow (whitelist) or deny (blacklist) links in topic posts (images and urls).

setting.conf_title: Which filter do you wish to use?
setting.conf_description: If you have enabled the url filtering, do you wish to use your blacklist or whitelist? You may only use one or the other.

You can specify here links that you explicitly want to allow. You may use * as a wildcard. One per line.

i.e.: http://www.yourdomain.com*
http://*google.com*

You can specify here links that you explicitely want to disallow. You may use * as a wildcard. One per line.

i.e.: http://*somedomain.com*
http://competitor_domain.com*

setting.conf_title: Show uploaded images in post as images?
setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", any image attachments in a post will be shown as the image and not as a downloadable link. Set this to yes to allow members to position their image attachments in the post using the [attachmentid] tag.

setting.conf_title: Maximum No. Thumbnails In a Row
setting.conf_description: This relates to the number of thumbnails that appear side-by-side before a line break to prevent the layout from distoring.
If the above option is set to "yes" to allow image attachments to show as the image select this option to show the attached image as a thumbnail which takes up less space and can be quicker to load.
If both options above are set to "yes", you can define the maximum width of the thumbnail. If attached images are smaller than the dimensions set here, they will not be shown as a thumbnail.
If both options above are set to "yes", you can define the maximum width of the thumbnail. If attached images are smaller than the dimensions set here, they will not be shown as a thumbnail.
This is for when a guest posts with a members name, it allows for a visual difference to prevent confusion
This is for when a guest posts with a members name, it allows for a visual difference to prevent confusion
Enter the maximum number of questions you wish to allow your members to create in a single poll.

setting.conf_title: Maximum number of poll choices allowed?
Allow members to view the results of a poll without losing their vote?
Allow poll creator to vote in own poll?
setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", the poll creator will have the option of voting in their own poll.

setting.conf_title: Allow poll creator to make "poll only"
setting.conf_description: Do you wish to allow posters who create polls to be able to disallow replies to the poll?

setting.conf_title: Number of hours to keep open the ability for topic starters to attach a poll to their topic
setting.conf_description: Does not affect administrators or super moderators

setting.conf_title: Allow members to use Rich Text Editing?
setting.conf_description: If 'yes', members using IE 6, Mozilla and Firefox will be able to use Rich Text Editing (WYSIWYG).

setting.conf_title: Make the side-panel open by default
setting.conf_description: If 'yes', the RTE side-panel (containing the emoticons and quick links section) will be open until the user clicks the 'Toggle Side Panel' button.

setting.conf_title_desc: The trashcan is a special forum in which topics are moved into instead of being deleted.

setting.conf_description: If set to "no", this feature will not activated and the settings below will be ignored.

setting.conf_title: Designate which forum to use as the trash can?
setting.conf_description: No special read/write/reply permissions are applied - please set up as if it were a normal forum.
If set to 'no', they will be able to delete as normal
If set to 'no', they will be able to delete as normal
If set to 'no', they will be able to delete as normal
If set to 'no', they will be able to delete as normal

setting.conf_title_desc: This section allows you to adjust your member's global permissions and other options.

setting.conf_description: This will allow you to globally disable the group prefix and suffix from formatting member names

setting.conf_title: Number of posts a member must have over before allowing them to change their member title?
setting.conf_description: Enter 0 to disable completely

setting.conf_title: Maximum length (in bytes) for the location field entry
Maximum length (in bytes) for the interests field entry
Maximum length (in bytes) for user signatures

setting.conf_description: This is NOT recommended unless you trust all your members who can add a signature.
What should the member's default editor type be when they register?

setting.conf_title: User selectable posts per page dropdown contents
setting.conf_description:
Separate with a comma, 'Use forum default' added automatically
Example: 5,15,20,25,30

setting.conf_title: User selectable topics per forum page dropdown contents
setting.conf_description:
Separate with a comma, 'Use forum default' added automatically
Example: 5,15,20,25,30

setting.conf_title: Auto prune all topic subscriptions if the topic has no replies over [x] days
setting.conf_description: Leave blank or enter 0 for no auto prune limit

Please choose which user groups you'd like to automatically be subscribed for email notification of new topics (not replies) in every forum available to them. This means that members having a selected PRIMARY group will be emailed everytime there is a new topic and they are not online to view it.
Note This will only send the email to those who have chosen to 'Allow emails from the administrators'.
Seperate with comma (gif,png,jpeg) etc

setting.conf_title: Allow users to use remote URL avatars?
Max. file size for avatar uploads? (K)

setting.conf_description: (WIDTHxHEIGHT)
(WIDTHxHEIGHT)

setting.conf_title: Number of columns for the avatar gallery?

setting.conf_description: Seperate with comma (gif,png,jpeg) etc

setting.conf_title: Disable IPB auto sizing large photos/avatars?
setting.conf_description: This will ask the member to input their dimensions

setting.conf_title: Allow GUESTS to view posted images?
Allow GUESTS to view user avatars?

setting.conf_description: If 'yes', the new profile portal will be disabled and the classic profile mode (IPB 2.1) will be used instead.

setting.conf_title: Allow members to rate each other?
setting.conf_description: If 'yes', members will be able to rate other members from their profiles.

setting.conf_title_desc: This section will allow you to set up the warning system.

setting.conf_description: If set to "no", the warn system will not be used and all warn levels will be hidden from view.

Minus numbers allowed. If using minus numbers, we recommend that you do not use the graphical blocks and percentage but use the 'rating' mode as 'warn mode' will not take into account a minus start number.
Members always start with a zero warn level when registered.

Groups that cannot be warned
You may choose more than one.

setting.conf_title: Allow all other non-protected groups to see their own warn level and reasons?
setting.conf_description: If set you "yes", members will be able to see their own warn level and reasons for their warns.

setting.conf_title: Allow warnings to continue once the minimum or maximum has been reached?

setting.conf_description: Controls which type of warn level meter is displayed.
setting.conf_extra: 0=Warn mode: Show graphical blocks & percentage 1=Rating mode: Show < min | current | max > level

setting.conf_title: Moderators can ban via warn panel?
setting.conf_description:
Applies to those moderators allowed to use the warning system
Admins can automatically do this via the warn panel.

setting.conf_title: Moderators can mod queue members via warn panel?
setting.conf_description:
Applies to those moderators allowed to use the warning system
Admins can automatically do this via the warn panel.

setting.conf_title: Moderators can remove post rights via warn panel?
setting.conf_description:
Applies to those moderators allowed to use the warning system
Admins can automatically do this via the warn panel.

setting.conf_title: Number of times per day moderators can warn a single member
Global Moderators can ban via warn panel?
setting.conf_description: Admins can automatically do this via the warn panel.

setting.conf_title: Global Moderators can mod queue members via warn panel?
setting.conf_description: Admins can automatically do this via the warn panel.

setting.conf_title: Global Moderators can remove post rights via warn panel?
setting.conf_description: Admins can automatically do this via the warn panel.

setting.conf_title: Number of times per day a global moderator can warn a single member

setting.conf_title_desc: Settings to manage your XML-RPC API interface

setting.conf_description: If 'yes' then your API users will be able to use the XML-RPC interface.
Which type of logging do you wish to record? 'All' will record all API access, 'Failed' will only log failed API accesses.
Enter the maximum number of days you wish to keep logs for. For example, if you entered '30' all logs older than 30 days will be removed.
